title: order applies against the Minister or the State authority specified in the
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the National Treasury Management Agency
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the National Treasury Management Agency 

(Delegation of Claims Management Functions) Order 2020.
text_norm: 1 order may cited national treasury management agency (delegation claim management functions) order 2020

title: order applies against the Minister or the State authority specified in the
heading: 2. This Order applies to a claim, other than a claim referred to in Article 3,
text_raw:
2. This Order applies to a claim, other than a claim referred to in Article 3, 

that - 

(a) 

is made against - 

(i) 

the State authority specified in the Schedule either alone 
or with any other person, in relation to or in connection 
with the provision of services by that State authority on 
behalf of the Health Service Executive under section 38 of 
the Health Act 2004 (No. 42 of 2004), and 

(ii) 

the Minister, where the claim referred to subparagraph (i) 
is also made against the Minister, 

and 

(b) 

either - 

(i) 

is made before the making of this Order and is one in 
respect of which the Agency and the State authority 
determine that it should be managed by the Agency, or 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 26th June, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [228] 3 

(ii) 

is made after the making of this Order irrespective of 
whether it relates to an act, omission or other matter 
occurring before or after such making.
text_norm: 2 order applies claim claim referred article 3 - (a) made - (i) state authority specified schedule either alone person relation connection provision service state authority behalf health service executive section 38 health act 2004 (no 42 2004) (ii) minister claim referred subparagraph (i) also made minister (b) either - (i) made making order one respect agency state authority determine managed agency notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 26th june 2020 228 3 (ii) made making order irrespective whether relates act omission matter occurring making

title: order applies against the Minister or the State authority specified in the
heading: 3. The following classes of claims are exempted from the delegation
text_raw:
3. The following classes of claims are exempted from the delegation 

effected by this Order: 

(a) 

claims made against the Minister or the State authority specified 
in the Schedule in respect of personal injury which include a 
claim in relation to liability for— 

(i) 

defective products, 

(ii) 

injurious falsehood, 

(iii) malicious prosecution, 

(iv) malicious abuse of the civil process, 

(v) deceit, or 

(vi) defamation.
text_norm: 3 following class claim exempted delegation effected order (a) claim made minister state authority specified schedule respect personal injury include claim relation liability for-- (i) defective product (ii) injurious falsehood (iii) malicious prosecution (iv) malicious abuse civil process (v) deceit (vi) defamation

title: order applies against the Minister or the State authority specified in the
heading: 4. The management of a claim to which this Order applies is delegated to
text_raw:
4. The management of a claim to which this Order applies is delegated to 

the Agency.
text_norm: 4 management claim order applies delegated agency

title: order applies against the Minister or the State authority specified in the
heading: It is declared that the Agency shall have the functions specified in
text_raw:
5. 

It is declared that the Agency shall have the functions specified in 
section 9(2)(a) of the National Treasury Management Agency (Amendment) 
Act 2000 (No. 39 of 2000). 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [228]
text_norm: 5 declared agency shall function specified section 9(2)(a) national treasury management agency (amendment) act 2000 (no 39 2000) 4 228

title: order applies against the Minister or the State authority specified in the
heading: Article 2
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

Article 2 

State authority to which paragraph (i) of the definition of “State authority” 
applies 

The Enfer Group being Enfer Labs Unlimited Company (the “Company”) and 
each subsidiary and associated company for the time being of the Company, 
each holding company of the Company and each subsidiary of such holding 
company, and includes their employees, agents, consultants and contractors. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [228] 5 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

19 June, 2020. 

LEO VARADKAR, 

Taoiseach. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [228]
text_norm: schedule article 2 state authority paragraph (i) definition state authority applies enfer group enfer lab unlimited company (the company ) subsidiary associated company time company holding company company subsidiary holding company includes employee agent consultant contractor 228 5 given official seal government 19 june 2020 leo varadkar taoiseach 6 228

title: order applies against the Minister or the State authority specified in the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

“This Order authorises the delegation to the State Claims Agency of 
responsibility for the management of certain claims incurred by the body listed 
in the schedule” 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [228] 7
